data.title: EH debugging: use massaged launch for attach
data.body:
As Andre pointed out:

@isidorn in EH debugging, the launchRequest starts the extension host (via VS Code) but the DA does not connect (aka "attach") to it (in normal "node" debugging the DA connects to the launched debuggee automatically).

Instead VS Code knows when the EH is ready and then broadcasts an event that you will pick up and issue the missing "attach" request for it. This is basically the same sequence as the "reload EH window" sequence.

For the "attach" request that you issue in response to the broadcast, you use the initial "launch" configuration and just change the "request" attribute from "launch" to "attach".
Since the initial "launch" config uses the type "extensionHost", the "attach" uses that too.

The fix is to remember the massaged launch config (that got the type "extensionHost2"), and create the "attach" config based on this.

data.title: rxjs/Observable - [ts] Argument of type '"Hello"' is not assignable to parameter of type 'number[]'
data.body:
- VSCode Version: Code 1.14.2 (cb82febafda0c8c199b9201ad274e25d9a76874e, 2017-07-19T23:34:09.706Z)
- OS Version: Windows_NT ia32 10.0.15063
- Extensions: none
---

Steps to Reproduce:

1. Create a "data service" file and importing rxjs/Observable
2. Create an observer and using method next of observer
3. Warning and error => [ts] Argument of type '"Hello"' is not assignable to parameter of type 'number[]'

data.title: Error when hitting ESC
data.body: testing #31457 * open a TypeScript file * run reference search so open peek view * hit esc * 💥 an error is thrown and makes it all the way into the UI

data.title: hue slider inconsistency
data.body:
Testing #31457:

A nit...

Opening the color picker on a shade of grey, the colour spectrum field on the left shows no colour, but the hue field shows the "thumb" (the horizontal line) at red:

![2017-07-28_12-20-23](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/1898161/28713470-6b2168f6-738f-11e7-8627-4793b48b9606.png)

moving the hue thumb a tiny bit adds colours to the colour spectrum:
 
![2017-07-28_12-24-38](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/1898161/28713552-c2608606-738f-11e7-80ad-95c90fa6463b.png)

So it seems that initially there is no "hue" and the correct way to represent this would be to show no hue thumb at all.

A consequence of this behaviour is that once hue has been clicked, there is no way to go back to non-hue mode.

testing #31457

See attached screen shot. By stirring around in the colours I must somehow to something* that dismisses the picker and starts scrolling towards...

![jul-28-2017 12-06-13](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/1794099/28712936-616e3ea8-738d-11e7-9264-e3f8aa759b07.gif)


* I believe mouse up is the trigger to this

data.title: Consider allowing to add loose files to multi-root workspaces and treating no-folder-scope as untitled workspace
data.body:
1. When working with multiple roots you might also want to "pin" relevant loose files without having them among your "open editors".

2. Besides you might also recurringly have workspaces with multiple loose files but without whole folders.

Allowing to not only have folders, but also files among the paths (currently _folders_) in a multi root workspace seems to me to make these use cases possible.

It seems to me that this would suggest to consider the _no folder scope_ an _untitled/unsaved_ (and of course _savable_) _multi-root workspace_.

I'm very keen on your feedback.

I searched for other issues covering this using both google and github's search and apparently didn't find anything. If this happens to be a duplicate or this has already been discussed in the comments of another issue I'd appreciate a link. Thanks

Related: #396 #28344 
@bpasero @jrieken

data.title: Color picker: Suport actual picker outside of the widget

milestone.title: Backlog
milestone.description: Work not yet planned for a specific release.

data.body:
Refs: #31457

My favorite google chrome color feature is the ability to open the picker click on the pen and just pick any color on the page. That color is immedaitly applied to the picker.
That way I steal colors from all over vscode happily.

I guess it is a bit complex, but opening as a feature request.

![pick](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/1926584/28712777-ae34fbd8-738c-11e7-817f-44b7b390908f.gif)

data.title: Color picker: disable other hovers
data.body:
Refs: #31457

I understand that currently there is some limiation and you can not stop the other hover from showing up, however this is confusing as the other hover seems to be a part of the color picker (in the example below: "color of an element's text")

Like debug, when you are showing the color picker you should disable the regular hover.
Assigning to July for discussion.

![screen shot 2017-07-28 at 11 58 15](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/1926584/28712603-10e9e186-738c-11e7-82ca-384bd4b42ce8.png)

data.title: Color picker do not show focus borders
data.body:
Refs: #31457

When you click on the color picker (which you surely will) we show a blue focus border. This is not needed, as it is there to indicate when the focus swtichtes to some element, hover in this case it is quite obvious that you are woring with the color picker.

We are also disabling focus boxes in the repl input for example.

![screen shot 2017-07-28 at 11 53 20](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/1926584/28712426-6291097a-738b-11e7-826b-9623f675241a.png)

data.title: Color picker: color pointer not visible
data.body:
Refs: #31457

1. Notice that the color pointer in the color picker is not visible enough it is always a green hollow circle

I see that chrome uses a white cirlce which is by far more visible.

A more advanced solution would be to always use the invert color of the one you are hovering over, that way it would always be visible.
White is better but when you go over light colors it is also invisible which is an accessiblity problem

Also in the HC theme it should have stronger color than white

data.title: Color picker: no hex?
data.body:
Refs: #31457

Clicking on the color picker title swithces between RGBS and HSLA. Why don't we also allow switching to # hex colors?

data.title: Color picker: can not read property x of undefined
data.body:
Refs: #31457

1. Open the color picker, notice the pointer in the bogus state described in the other issue

Trigger color picker on a color, notice the initial state of the color pointer is always in the top left corner which is wrong.

![screen shot 2017-07-28 at 11 38 54](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/1926584/28711883-5a760e7c-7389-11e7-85bf-0d9f7652c0a4.png)

data.title: Color picker: dismissing the picker with ESC should not apply changes

milestone.title: Backlog
milestone.description: Work not yet planned for a specific release.

data.body:
Refs: #31457

1. Trigger color picker and choose a brand new color
2. Dismiss the color picker using ESC
3. The color should not be applied and you should go back to the original color

Without this I do not see the way to undo your work without using the ugly editor undo.

data.title: Color Picker: Clicking on the original color should bring back that color

milestone.title: Backlog
milestone.description: Work not yet planned for a specific release.

data.body:
Refs: #31457

1. The color picker currently in the upper right corner shows the original color
2. Clicking on it should bring back the original color

This would make it easier for users to go back to their inital color.

data.title: Color picker: keep it around while mouse moved over color
data.body:
Refs: #31457

1. Invoke color picker by putting the mouse on top of the css color
2. Move the mouse over the color -> picker gets hidden
3. I would expect the picker to get hidden only when the mouse is completely moved of the color, not while I am moving it over a valid color picker target

![colorpicker](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/1926584/28711566-4b3c43dc-7388-11e7-8a20-98fca80b3924.gif)

data.title: Color Picker: Keyboard accessibility

milestone.title: Backlog
milestone.description: Work not yet planned for a specific release.

data.body:
Refs: #31457

It is good that the color picker can be triggered via our "Show Hover" command, however after that you can not do any changes to it using the keyboard.
It should be possible to use the keyboard to navigate inside the color picker and choose colors appropriatly.

data.title: [plugin-dev] question: when plugin cannot find the definition of a symbol for completion, how to do to fallback to editor raw completion ?
data.body:
- VSCode Version: 1.14.0
- OS Version: windows 7

i have develope a language plugin which provide completion support, the plugin use symbol definitions as completion list, but when the plugin cannot find the definition of a symbol for completion, how can i do to fallback to the editor word completion ?

data.title: Search unit tests fail on Windows
data.body:
Both win 32 and 64 builds are blocked by this test:

```
2017-07-28T08:38:38.3419886Z   1) QueryBuilder parseSearchPaths absolute includes:
2017-07-28T08:38:38.3419886Z 
2017-07-28T08:38:38.3419886Z       AssertionError: 2 == 1
2017-07-28T08:38:38.3419886Z       + expected - actual
2017-07-28T08:38:38.3419886Z 
2017-07-28T08:38:38.3419886Z       -2
2017-07-28T08:38:38.3419886Z       +1
2017-07-28T08:38:38.3419886Z       
2017-07-28T08:38:38.3419886Z       at assertEqualSearchPathResults (file:///D:/work/agent1/1/s/out-build/vs/workbench/parts/search/test/common/queryBuilder.test.js:296:16)
2017-07-28T08:38:38.3419886Z       at testIncludes (file:///D:/work/agent1/1/s/out-build/vs/workbench/parts/search/test/common/queryBuilder.test.js:63:17)
2017-07-28T08:38:38.3419886Z       at testIncludesDataItem (file:///D:/work/agent1/1/s/out-build/vs/workbench/parts/search/test/common/queryBuilder.test.js:67:17)
2017-07-28T08:38:38.3419886Z       at Array.forEach (native)
2017-07-28T08:38:38.3419886Z       at Context.<anonymous> (file:///D:/work/agent1/1/s/out-build/vs/workbench/parts/search/test/common/queryBuilder.test.js:134:19)
```

In order to get builds for testing today, I will comment the test out temporarily.

data.title: Run hygiene in TFS builds
VScode did not set BOM into UTF-8 file when you create a new file and save it
data.body:
- VSCode Version: Code 1.14.2 (cb82febafda0c8c199b9201ad274e25d9a76874e, 2017-07-19T23:34:09.706Z)
- OS Version: Windows_NT ia32 10.0.15063
- Extensions: 

Extension|Author (truncated)|Version
---|---|---
cpptools|ms-|0.12.1
csharp|ms-|1.11.0
PowerShell|ms-|1.4.1
Ruby|reb|0.12.1



---

Steps to Reproduce:

1.Create a new file and put Unicode string.
ex.
Write-Host "Unicode characters"
2.Save it as PowerShell file
3.Run powershell and type below
PS>type "saved file"

.ps1 file does not have BOM, then Unicode characters will be corrupted

<!-- Launch with `code --disable-extensions` to check. -->
Reproduces without extensions: Yes
